page.title: 18The Midsummer Eve Bonfire
page.content: Originally this was a pagan custom in honour of the sun, sometimes with human or animal sacrifices. Nowadays it is on the eve of St.John and is supposed to drive away bad luck and to bring good luck. In St.Cleer the fire was crowned with a witch's hat and broomstick, and a sickle with a handle of new oak was thrown into the flames, to drive away witches. Herbs that are supposed to have good and bad influences are tied with coloured ribbons and thrown into the fire. Some of the 'good' herbs are elder, fennel, larkspur and sage. 'Bad' herbs include brambles,thistles, dock, nettles, cinquefoil and mayweed. People dance and sing around the fire and will leap over the dying flames for good luck. Good luck will also come if you keep some of the ashes in your home until the next year
